Barby Ingle is a chronic pain educator, patient advocate, and president of the International Pain Foundation, as well as a motivational speaker and best selling author on pain topics. She has been a pain patient since developing endometriosis in 1997, and reflex sympathetic dystrophy in 2002. She began mentoring other patients in 2006.  Barby also serves on the board of advisers for CureClick, is a member of SPPAN, and a founding member of CPATF.

Extreme Time Cheaters on the TLC Network is a new show on saving time featuring Ken and BarbyKen Taylor and Barby Ingle (married), residents of San Tan Valley, Arizona have been featured in an upcoming pilot show ‘Extreme Time Cheaters’ on TLC Network. The show will air on December 30, 2015 at 7pm MST.“Some people will do anything to save time. Time cheaters go to extreme measures to shave seconds off their daily routines. From doing the dishes while showering, to body waxing at work, they all go to extreme lengths to make every second count!” - TLCKen and Barby share their life as caregiver and pain patient who cheat time to get the best experience from each life moment. They share their unique ideas for doctor visits, painting your toe nails in a flash, multitasking, and even tips for throwing a party with efficiency. This super couple puts a human face on organizing life and showing viewers how to achieve the maximum goodness while having a whole lot of fun.Ken and Barby are chronic pain educators, patient advocates, and are on the board of directors for the International Pain Foundation. They are also motivational speakers and authors on pain topics. Barby has been a pain patient since developing endometriosis in 1997, and reflex sympathetic dystrophy in 2002.###

Manage a staff of 40 employees. Plan, staff, and coordinate all Cheertec cheerleading events.  Perform administrative and legal tasks pertinent to managing a small business. Head trainer for all instructional and judging staff.  Create and choreograph original Cheertec program material.  Teach curriculum to cheerleaders within the school system as well as to individuals in private programs.  Administer a yearly scholarship competition for cheerleaders & head safety judge for competitions.

Responsible for the coordination, coaching and administration of the Spirit Squads (cheer and dance) and Mascot programs.  Including scheduling, conducting practices, choreography, travel, budget requests and overseeing daily and game/ event functions of squads, ordering uniforms and supplies, writing and distribution of rules and regulations manual.  This position is full time with benefits.  Computer skills applied everyday of work, Microsoft word, Excel, PowerPoint, Net Objects Fusion, Page Maker, Illustrator, and Outlook. Coached at 2 Rose Bowls and The Sun Bowl.

The Power of Pain Foundation’s mission is to educate and show support for Chronic Pain Patients, specifically those with Neuropathy Pain conditions including Reflex Sympathetic Dystrophy (RSD), Diabetic Neuropathy, Lyme Disease, MS, and Post Cancer Pain. We fulfill our mission by:~ Promoting public and professional awareness of Neuropathy chronic pain conditions~ Educating those afflicted with the syndrome, their families, friends and healthcare providers on the disabling pain it causes.~ Action-oriented public awareness, education, and pain policy improvement through activities and efforts to eliminate the under treatment of chronic pain.

summary: Celebrity Pain Advocate, Barby Ingle, has been featured in the media over 850 times over the years. Most notably 2017: CBS Las Vegas on #OurPain 10 part series, ABC News on the Opioid Epidemic, NBC Sunday Square Off; 2016: Extreme Time Cheaters on TLC; 2015: Brainstormers on The Weather Channel, 2014: Pain Pathways Magazine Cover Celebrity Story, Focus Today on The Dove TV, The Talk on CBS; Redbook Magazine 2013: The Doctor's TV Show, 2012: Dr. Drew's Lifechangers, and the Newlywed Game, Women's Day Magazine, My First For Women Magazine 2011: ABC’s Smart Family, Sunday Sunrise (07, 09, 10, 2011) airing on 3 CBS stations in Phoenix, “Extra Story” (2010) on AZTV, Ch.3, and AZ Good Morning Arizona, 3 on Your Side, the 9pm News “Big Story” (2009). Patient Mentor since 2006. Chairman of the Power of Pain Foundation (2013-2014), Director of The POPF (2009-2012). Testified at the Department of Defense for the Veterans Administration Disability Rating Committee (10/25/10)  Chronic Pain Educator, guest speaker & National Motivational speaker since 2007. #CheerleaderOfHopePrior to her auto accident causing chronic pain and subsequent surgeries, Barby was a business owner, event coordinator and head coach at Washington State University for the spirit program. She had been speaking at charity events, awards ceremonies, special groups and all kinds of public venues as part of her job as a Collegiate Head Coach, beauty pageant queen, business owner.Graduated from George Mason Univ in 1994 w a degree in Social Psychology, Barby uses her skills from cheerleading to inspire and motivate patients to be self-advocates and offers tips and tools for patients, caretakers and healthcare professionals. She has also served as a National speaker, Author of the Cheertec Coaches'​ Handbook; six part DVD Series on cheerleading, From Wheels to Heals, RSD in Me!, ReMission Possible, The Pain Code, Real Love, & Aunt Barby's Invisible, Endless Owie & more.More at www.barbyingle.com
